statement.tex: \text{What would be the largest term numerically}\\ \text{in the expansion of }(2+3x)^9\text{ if }x=\frac{3}{2}?

step.reason: \textbf{First, }\text{note that every }T_n\text{ in the expansion}\\ \text{of }(2+3x)^9\text{ with }x=\frac{3}{2}\text{ is }\gt 0.\text{ This would}\\ \text{not have been true if instead of }(2+3x)^9\\ \text{we had }(2-3x)^9.\\ \text{Now, if }T_n\text{ is the largest term, then}\\ \begin{align} T_n - T_{n-1} &\gt 0 \implies T_n \gt T_{n-1}\implies \dfrac{T_n}{T_{n-1}}\gt 1\\ T_{n+1}-T_n &\lt 0\implies T_{n+1}\lt T_n\implies \dfrac{T_{n+1}}{T_n}\lt 1 \end{align}
